job.title: Digital/Technical Product Manager Senior (Digital Content Strategist) (Remote work location available)
job.body:
Purpose of Job

We are currently seeking a talented Digital/Technical Product Manager Senior (Digital Content Strategist) for one of the following locations: San Antonio Campus or 100% Remote Work Environment.

The Digital Content Strategist will be responsible for overseeing content requirements and creating content strategy deliverables across a project life cycle. The individual in this role will initiate, develop and facilitate content across Digital Platforms (Web, App, IVR and chatbot).

Facilitates the discovery, delivery, and performance of digital and technology products and their experiences for USAA and its members. Collaborates with internal stakeholders and partners to tackle complex and challenging problems to optimize the customers’ (internal/external) experience with market offerings. Designs and drives implementation of multi-platform technology and digital solutions. Optimizes and improves existing products and experiences across delivery channels and platforms to drive Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Key Risk Indicators (KRIs). Employs User Centered Design and Design Thinking methodologies to bring world-class Digital and/or Technology driven products to market. Develops the product strategy, vision, and goals and justifies decision-making related to the balance and mix of innovation types and investments.

Job Requirements

USAA knows what it means to serve. We facilitate the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. This singular mission requires a dedication to innovative thinking at every level.

In each of the past five years, we've been a top-40 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For®, and we've ranked among Victory Media's Top 10 Military Friendly® Employers 13 years straight. We embrace a robust veteran workforce and encourage veterans and veteran spouses to apply.

https://www.youtube.com/user/usaajobs/videos

  • Identifies and manages existing and emerging risks that stem from business activities and the job role.
  • Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled.
  • Follows written risk and compliance policies and procedures for business activities.
  • Independently leverages Digital or Technology research, business and market intelligence, and data-driven insights to identify opportunities, propose solutions, create and maintain roadmaps, and improve performance.
  • Translates Digital or Technology product and experience opportunities (customer “needs” and “wants” as well as all other input forms into problems, gaps, etc.) into initiatives (i.e., requirements, epics, features) and drives execution strategy.
  • Shepherds complex Digital or Technology product and experience opportunities from idea to market validation through collaboration with all relevant stakeholders and SMEs (Business, UX, Technology, Ops, Marketing, etc.).
  • Leads the development of Business Case artifacts and hypotheses for scoping and prioritization of efforts.
  • Continuously leverages advanced data-driven problem-solving techniques and analytical rigor to understand and report on product and experience performance against KPIs/KRIs.
  • Generates meaningful insights through a variety of tools and resources to uncover areas of opportunity to inform Digital or Technology product and experience improvements.
  • Leads cross-functional product teams and relationships to discover and build new Digital or Technology products, experiences, and features by collaborating with stakeholders and organizational leaders to coordinate product development efforts aligned with strategic priorities.
  • Prepares compelling presentations, and other forms of communication standards and templates, to present and communicate complex concepts to a diverse audience, including senior leadership.
  • Conducts internal and external research and conducts situational analysis to identify and apply industry best practices and trends to increase effectiveness of Digital or Technology products.
  • Begins to bring in “big picture” thinking and seeks to drive clarity among team and stakeholders.
  • Maintains and applies advanced knowledge of the Business, Technology, UX, and relevant experiences and processes, and an academic understanding of Product Management.
  • Serves as a resource to team members and assists with on-boarding new employees.

Minimum Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree required OR 4 additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a degree (10 years of experience in lieu of a degree).
  • 6 years Product Management, Digital/Technology experience or directly related experience in Strategy/Planning, Innovation, User Experience, Process Engineering, Research/Testing and/or Operations within Insurance or Financial services industry.
  • Proven ability to effectively develop, influence, present and communicate complex concepts to cross-functional teams, non-technical users, and leadership.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in an Agile, Lean Product Development and Lean Portfolio Management environment.
  • Knowledge of digital and technology strategy and delivery as it relates to roadmap development, journey mapping, competitive analysis and research, and situation analysis methods.
  • Knowledge of digital and technology strategy and delivery as it relates to Experience Design concepts and Human Centered Design concepts, roadmap development, journey mapping, competitive analysis and research, and situation analysis methods.

*Qualifications may warrant placement in a different job level*

When you apply for this position, you will be required to answer some initial questions. This will take approximately 5 minutes. Once you begin the questions you will not be able to finish them at a later time and you will not able to change your responses.

Preferred Experience:

  • Minimum 3+ years in building Content Strategies and writing content for Web and / or Mobile experiences
  • Minimum 3+ years Banking experience

  • Knowledge of technical aspects of SEO, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Schema, URL structures, keyword analysis, content optimization, search engine spiders, indexes and algorithms, and other factors that impact SEO

At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits package in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. USAA also offers a variety of on-site services and conveniences to help you manage your work and personal life, including seven cafeterias, two company stores and three fitness centers.

job.body:

Full Job Description

ABOUT US

WAVE Electronics is the largest independent CI (Custom Integrator) distributor in the nation. WAVE Electronics services local and national dealers that span across multiple channels of business that include residential/commercial A/V, and security. WAVE Electronics is recognized as the "one-stop" solution with over 8000 stock items from 126 premium manufacturers.

WE’RE LOOKING FOR OUR “GO TO PERSON”.

The Senior Digital Specialist is responsible for ensuring the strategic alignment between the organization’s goals and the development of digital marketing campaigns to meet those objectives.

REQUIRED SKILLS

· Experience in branding and B2B marketing

· Experience working with Klaviyo or similar email marketing system

· Experience working with Shopify is a plus

· Solid experience in market research, analytics, and segmentation

· Knowledgeable about digital channels (Google, Yelp, Twitter, Facebook, and others) and capable of effectively leveraging them for content

· Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, good understanding of digital marketing strategies as well as organic search, keyword optimization, and reporting metrics

· Understanding of all applicable consumer laws/regulations (CAN-SPAM, CASL, CCPR, GDPR, etc.)

· Exceptional writing, editing, proofreading, and research skills

· Team player who can build strong relationships with multiple teams to plan and execute email campaigns and oversee their full lifecycle

HERE’S WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

· Lead projects to develop marketing campaigns, brand collateral, and digital marketing strategies

· Manage brand resources and processes to enable consistent brand delivery, i.e., message frameworks, visual assets, key terminology, and accurate data

· Track and measure the effectiveness of digital marketing efforts and strategies

· Perform market research to implement data-driven digital marketing campaigns to meet company’s strategic goals

· Work closely with the digital team to support the organization’s growth by developing content marketing and demand generation strategies that drive awareness and engagement

· Provide insight and analysis on the value and potential ROI of new marketing platforms and emerging marketing channels

· Collaborate with the digital team to optimize website content and conversions, including UX design, SEO, and content development

· Develop a centralized marketing calendar to include social media campaigns, email campaigns, and spotlight articles, overseeing their full life cycle, including creative/copy development, data segmentation, and reporting/analysis

  • Other projects as assigned

YOUR SCHEDULE

You’ll be working from our HQ Houston office & you’ll need to be a self-motivated rock star who takes pride in their work, and work-ethic.

Most of us work from 8am-5pm.

COMPENSATION

You’ll start right away as a full-time employee, with a standard 40-hour work week. As described above, occasionally we’ll need to work longer to meet a deadline or get the job done.

The salary is commensurate with experience

We offer a full benefit package with PTO, medical, dental, vision, disability benefits and employee purchase program.

IF YOU’RE STILL READING, THEN YOU MIGHT BE THE ONE TO FOLLOW THE NEXT STEPS: HOW TO APPLY FOR THE POSITION - READ CAREFULLY

Your Next Step: To be considered for an interview follow the next steps carefully:

1. Attach a cover letter with the following:

o IMPORTANT. In the title line write: “WAVE HR team, I’m perfect for this rock-star right hand position, and here’s why!”

o In the body of the cover letter tell us why you’d be perfect for this position AND you must include your salary requirements.

o Also include your resume.

2. FOLLOW UP - We will call you to set up a phone interview and/or a zoom call if we like what we see!

job.title: Backend Software Engineer - Remote
job.body:
The Opportunity
The Software Engineer role will be a part of a lean, nimble, full stack powerful engineering team. We value simplicity in both our code and our UI. We don't believe in bloated teams or overly architected solutions; we opt for small, nimble players that work well together, iterates fast and achieves more as a high-powered team. Since we're a small team, you'll have the opportunity to work on virtually all aspects of the software and have a direct and immediate impact! This role will advance our cutting-edge data search engine and social profiling platform. The role will build scalable backend microservices, APIs and database structures using Node / Express / Postgres, etc. We have a service-oriented architecture, two client facing platforms, a web app, and a Chrome extension supported by around 9 other services (with an internal API to connect them). You will be at the core of every new feature, every product decision, and every touch point of our users. You will not be micromanaged and have full autonomy to design the architecture and engineer the features / products for scale. If you are a problem solver and enjoy having the ability to think creatively with your code, you would love being on this team.
About Seamless
Seamless delivers the world's best sales leads. Through our product, we help sales teams maximize revenue, increase sales, and easily acquire their total addressable market using artificial intelligence. We have been recognized as one of Ohio's fastest growing companies and just won an award for Best Technology Company of the year in 2019 by NJTC,Best Place to Work in 2020, and a Top 50 Linkedin Startup!
The Seamless Family
We have an amazing culture and work environment that anyone would want to be a part of. We encourage a culture of positivity. We thrive off of continuous feedback and do whatever it takes to help our team and customers be successful. You will grow as an individual, professionally, and be able to see and feel the impact you are making to the growth of Seamless every day.

Duties / Responsibilities:

  • Design, Development, and implementation of scalable and performant backend microservices handling large quantities of concurrent requests and data (initially this role will be responsible for backend development but will also require frontend, full stack).
  • Creating database schemas that represent and support business processes to support hundreds of millions of records.
  • Solve complex near real-time web engineering problems with big data.
  • Passion for building backend technologies that have the power to positively impact millions.
  • Regularly (and often frequently) shipping quality finished code - working in an AGILE/MVP format is key.
  • Creating full features, relatively unsupervised.

Skills / Requirements:

  • 5+ years experience building highly-available, scalable and modern Javascript web applications (full stack development experience ideal / a plus).
  • Expert knowledge of modern back-end development and back-end JavaScript (Node.js, Express, Aurora Postgres).
  • A firm grasp of Computer Science fundamentals including object oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving and complexity analysis.
  • Strong knowledge of asynchronous programming patterns and service-oriented architecture (SOA) solutions.
  • Experience developing internal APIs, and integrating with 3rd party APIs.

You Fit Our Culture If You...

  • Value autonomy and ownership of your work
  • Self-motivated engineer with the ability to work well with a small team of highly-driven / entrepreneurial Developers
  • Willingness to go beyond the standard “9-5” when needed. We love what we do, and often find ourselves working nights and/or weekends to get the job done
  • Possess innate passion for coding, software development, and big data!
PM19
Disclaimer: This is a full-time remote position, headquartered out of Columbus, OH. We are open to assisting with relocation and willing to discuss U.S. remote for the right candidate. Visa Sponsorship is not included in our hiring package. Applicants will need to be authorized to work in the U.S.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
No Recruiters. This is an internal position our internal team is hiring for.

job.title: Product Design Architect
job.body:
Business Development/Sales Group Regular Chicago, Illinois, United States of America Posted on:11/16/2020 Job ID:R-9457
Our story starts with a simple universal truth: Every business is a people business. Our people are our greatest assets at Alight Solutions. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects everything we work for (wealth, health, happiness) with the lives we want. Our success is fueled by the expertise of our people, and the strength of our proprietary and partner technology. Come join the leading HR tech company and help us reimagine how people and organizations thrive.

You’ve wowed stakeholders at startups, Fortune 500 companies, and consultancies with your storytelling, insights, and experience strategy and design. You are focused on the interactive—web and mobile applications, interactive design and user experience. You serve as project lead and main point person for engagements, leading the experience strategy and establishing and maintaining the highest quality of execution across all work. If this sounds like you, keep reading.

We’re looking for an experienced and profoundly engaged Product Design Architect based in Chicago, IL or virtually, responsible for reimagining employee experiences for 26m users and their families and shipping the next generation of transformative, integrated, scalable, and robust enterprise products. The Architect provides team leadership, builds strong partnerships and fosters collaboration with clients and employees They help advise and align project teams, create successful outcomes and ensure the highest level of end user satisfaction. They’re passionate and pragmatic design thinkers eager to join a fun, collaborative and innovative team.

The Product Design Architect works closely with Design Leads and Product Design Directors to develop the strategy and direction. They will be expected to lead initiatives which bring together senior stakeholders to drive collaboration, understanding and decision making. This role does not have direct reports but will be expected to lead multidisciplinary teams in a variety of design initiatives from human insights development to prototyping new digital experiences. We know that takes all types of people and believe diverse backgrounds and experiences creates a stronger Alight.

Key Responsibilities

The individual will be involved in the following critical activities:

Collaborating with a world-class team of Product Designers, UX Design Researchers, Content designers and Product Managers
Discover the real-world problems that get in the way when people and organizations try to thrive
Leverage design-thinking methods and participate and contribute to new methods and offerings
Assist with digital strategies and visions and ensure these are communicated effectively
Understand and guide research, interaction and visual design across apps, platforms and solutions, driving towards the highest level of quality and execution
Present concepts clearly and justify design decisions
Help manage changes in project scope, identify potential issues and pivot when necessary
Collaborate with internal team members to structure project work, plan and execute product design initiatives
Lead and drive key experience design activities throughout a project’s lifecycle including research, workshops and conducting interviews and synthesizing
Identify and resolve or escalate issues and conflicts within the project team
Coach a project team of Design colleagues with multidisciplinary backgrounds including visual design, interaction design, information architecture, etc.
Hands-on with project team to create user scenarios, user flows, information architecture (IA) and pixel-perfect mockups and prototypes that include compelling interactions for websites, mobile apps, native apps and more
Prototype, test, and iterate on designs; evaluate usability of existing systems as well as preliminary designs
Presents research, strategy and design work to internal clients for review
Collaborates effectively with developers, strategists, product managers, executives, Creative Directors and other designers to craft solutions for a variety of different platforms and industries
Facilitates collaborative client discovery and design workshops and participates in ideations
Motivates and champions award-wining Design at all times
Experience in multitasking and working in ambiguous situations
Help support a shared design vision across the company by building consensus on priorities leading to product design and execution
Grow a culture of design and ship with speed, consistency, and quality; rebuilding our culture

Knowledge, Education, Certification, Skills & Technical Proficiencies

The ideal experience and critical competencies for the role include the following:

Live and breathe to design the future and have an award-winning portfolio (product, websites, apps, services, systems, etc) to prove it
Experience with or background in design, social sciences, or humanities
Fluency in best practices for information architecture and interaction design, life-centered design process, as well as strong knowledge of user experience principles and techniques
Expertise in Adobe Creative Cloud, Sketch, Miro/Mural, InVision a must; HTML, Javascript & CSS preferred
Proven experience designing applications that balance user needs, business requirements, commercial interests and technological constraints
Well-versed in technology and software development as it relates to design
Proactive, self-sufficient and professional, with strong organizational, time management and communication skills

job.title: Commercial Bank - Senior Product and Service Designer, Vice President
job.body:
We're looking for a seasoned Product and Service Designer with a human-centered mindset to help create and drive the next generation of financial experiences for JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPMC). Whether observing users, co-creating with stakeholders, or working with fellow team members, you are passionate about representing the human perspective and translating insight into tangible and delightful customer experiences at the intersection of digital products and financial services. Your design work will have reach and impact on a massive scale in the financial services sector while working in a creative, dynamic and fast pace environment.
Role & Responsibilities
  • Participate in the end-to-end design process contributing to the generation, critique and iteration of digital products and services across various financial touch points, channels and entire eco-systems.
  • Plan and conduct user research with current and potential customers, in close collaboration with design and business leaders in the organization.
  • Synthesize large bodies of research data to provide insights, identify opportunities, and generate conceptual frameworks.
  • Translate and bridge research to tangible design opportunities and outputs (often times playing at the intersection of UX and service design).
  • Facilitate co-creative sessions (e.g. user research, brainstorming, concepting) with key stakeholders.
  • Create tailored artifacts such as presentations, reports, visual maps, prototypes, story boards, service blueprints, journey maps, personas, etc. to help our stakeholders understand and drive actionable paths forward.
  • Drive design thought leadership internally and externally across the firm.
Required Skills
  • Master's Degree in Service, Strategy, Interaction or other design-related field.
  • +5 years industry experience in human-centered and/or participatory methods of design to identify unmet customer, market and institutional needs with demonstrated track record of creating new design concepts, services or business strategies to meet those needs.
  • An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating relevant experience.
  • Proficiency in design thinking and service design methods/mindsets.
  • Proven experience designing applications and services that balance user needs, commercial interests, and technological constraints
  • Experience working in multi-faceted and complex stakeholder environments; working closely with product, business, technical and design leaders
  • Demonstrated knowledge of design tools and methods (i.e. conducting research, facilitating workshops, generating conceptual frameworks and formulating insights related to the synthesis of the research data; creating tangible, compelling design expressions that communicate vision, and help our stakeholders develop great solutions.)
  • Demonstrated ability to thrive in an ambiguous and dynamic multi-disciplinary environment balancing and managing diverse stakeholder needs
  • Outstanding verbal and writing communication skills to include C-level executives
  • Ability to concept and create prototypes (even in lo-fidelity) to learn and improve your ideas
  • Strong visual communicator in artifacts and work produced. Ability to communicate abstract design concepts visually, in a beautiful, clear and engaging manner.
  • Proficiency with design tools (i.e. Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Invision, Figma)
  • Understanding of UX design principles and ability to bridge service experiences and touchpoints within a digital and product design context
  • Ability to collaborate across various functional areas in the organizations and make the case for change through design

Nice to have

  • Experience in the application of design systems (e.g. Material Design)
  • Knowledge/past experiences in financial services

Location
  • Our office is located in New York City. However, due to Covid-19, most of us are currently working remotely.

What's cool about this Job?

WP Engine is seeking a Principal Product Manager to lead and build new, modern, content APIs. We’re looking for someone with a passion for crafting technology that developers love to utilize and that enables them to build multifaceted and performant digital experiences. You will be the inspiring leader as it pertains to how content is served and rendered from the WordPress CMS, along with all of the steps and processes it takes to make that happen.

You’ll be working closely with our developer relations team and sales, marketing, and customer experience organizations to share customer insights, market trends, and internal analysis. You should be comfortable working with C-suite partners and driving your vision across the company. You’ll be taking a product from idea to inception so you’ll need to be comfortable with ambiguity, creative problem solving, and rapid response to customer needs.

In this role, you’ll be working with the Senior Manager of Product and Founder/CTO to be responsible for the API strategy of our WordPress development platform.

Day to Day

Your Expertise and Passion

job.title: Front End Developer
job.body:
Job details

Salary
$110,000 - $135,000 a year
Job Type
Full-time

Qualifications

    • Front End Development: 5 years (Required)

    • E-commerce development: 3 years (Required)

    • Mobile applications development: 3 years (Required)

    • US work authorization (Required)

Full Job Description

We’re looking for a razor-sharp UI/UX front-end developer who is obsessed with split testing to join our 100% remote world-class digital optimization team. We’re heavy DTC advertisers and our success is linked to how well our web and mobile acquisition funnels convert. So, we’ve created a standalone digital optimization SWAT team that can focus exclusively on iterating rapidly with high volume conversion rate optimization (CRO) testing. If you’re obsessed with creating the perfect user experience, love to contribute your ideas and get a thrill when your test wins, please read on.

Who Are We?

Metabolic Living is a self-funded, profitable, rapidly growing multi-channel DTC health and wellness company with 100+ on our team and on pace to hit $50MM in 2020. For the last 9 years we’ve been quietly developing our metabolic optimization products and fine-tuning our business model. Everything is now clicking, so we’re stepping on the gas as we march towards our goal of becoming a billion-dollar multi-channel brand by 2024. We’ve always been 100% remote and will stay that way as we scale.

We’re fortunate to be thriving during these challenging COVD times as we provide exactly what everyone wants. The overall trend towards health and wellness was already a wind in our sails, but COVID lit a match and set our growth on fire, dramatically accelerating things. This is your opportunity to help us make a meaningful impact, precisely at the time when the world needs it the most.

What are the Key Points?

  • Compensation: $110,000 - $135,000 (plus bonus)
  • Location: 100% Remote (virtual team of 100+ with no corporate office)
  • Benefits: Health/Dental/Vision/Disability/Life + Robust 401k + 15 Days PTO
  • Hours: 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. EASTERN (regardless of where you live)
  • Culture: Human-first with High-Performing, Happy & Humble People (no jerks)
  • Personality: Obsessed with Distilling the Complex into the Simple

What’s the Big Opportunity?

Hello, my name is Kaitlin Reiss, Head of Ecommerce at Metabolic Living, and I need your help. We’ve hired the leader of our digital optimization team who has 3,200 split tests under his belt (yes, really!). And now we’re recruiting the remaining pieces of this world-class team as we get ready to launch two major strategic initiatives to introduce our new brand: our state-of-the-art e-commerce website and customized metabolic optimization app that leverages machine learning and AI. We couldn’t be more excited to build this dedicated digital optimization team because it means we can move lightning fast.

If you’re as obsessed with testing as I am, this is a dream-scenario. I joined the company because I wanted to be part of building their new brand, to build something special, to build it the right way. But building things the right way is a constant process of optimization. And to do that we need the help of a world-class UI/UX front-end developer who can help us rapidly iterate.

That’s why this is a fantastic opportunity for someone with an inquisitive, consumer-oriented mindset who’s oozing with ideas and obsessed with creating amazing user experiences that convert like crazy. You get annoyed when pixels aren’t perfect and when UXs and UIs don’t make sense… and scratch your head when you buy something on another website or app and wonder why their checkout process is so inefficient! You love to get creative and your first instinct at a challenge is never “it can’t be done” but rather “I’ll figure it out” … and then you deliver and make it happen.

Sure, we need someone who can carve up mockups… but were looking for so much more. We want your ideas! We want to tap into your creative problem-solving brain to improve overall usability and to smartly leverage technology to make everything faster, more scalable, smoother, and easier. You’ll work with the CRO director, UX/UI designer, copywriter and other SWAT team members to develop hypotheses, propose treatments, collaboratively build tests, analyze results for key learnings and repeat.

Your days will be exciting and filled with variety. One day you might be optimizing a quiz in our performance funnels… another day you may be optimizing a checkout or upsell page our e-comm website… another day you might be optimizing the onboarding experience in our customized metabolic optimization app.

What’s Our Culture Like?

We’re serious about high-performance, so our culture is built around deep work to allow uninterrupted time for the intense concentration needed to deliver world-class performance. At the same time, real collaboration and transparency is critical to keep us all in alignment and keep office politics out of the equation. These aren’t just talking points – we’ve implemented specific policies, for example:

  • A standardized 8:30 to 5:00 p.m. ET schedule to protect your personal and family time
  • No meetings before 1 p.m. ET to empower you with 4 hours truly of deep work to GSD
  • Daily huddles and weekly 1-on-1s to support your ability to focus on what matters most

Should You Apply?

If after reading this it’s screaming “this is for me” and…

  • You LOVE split testing and are completely addicted to testing and learning…
  • You LOVE tinkering with user interfaces until they’re just right…
  • You LOVE writing clean, efficient code that turns Zeplin mockups into pixel-perfect executions…
  • You LOVE figuring out how to create fast-loading websites and apps with the best tech…
  • You LOVE being part of a cross-functional high-performing team that moves fast…

Then please read on as you’re the ideal candidate… and we’d love to talk to you ASAP.

What Does Metabolic Living Do?

The most common question we get is – what the heck do you do? Because from the outside in, unless you’re a customer, it can be confusing, There’s a reason: We built everything organically in reverse, starting with our first nutrition program in 2012, then our first exercise program in 2014 and then launching our full ecosystem of products, including nutraceuticals, functional foods, subscriptions, memberships, 1-on-1 coaching and more. These are all marketed separately under different DTC websites and brands in a direct response (DR) manner.

And now we’re centralizing everything under our new brand, Metabolic Living, with our flagship website and app launching later this year, transitioning us from purely DR to a multi-channel traditional brand. The website at metabolicliving.com is a temporary one for COVID to raise $45k for frontline health workers. This website will be replaced with the fully branded e-commerce-driven one soon.

Normally, companies launch with a brand and then figure out how to make money. We did that in reverse – pinpointing pain points, curating world-class products, validating product-market match, generating cash flow to self-fund our growth, creating our north star (see more below), building out our operational team along the way and then retrofitting the brand on top. Strange path, but here we are. Read our full story here: https://www.linkedin.com/company/metabolic-living/about/.

We provide the full ecosystem of products and services that help you quickly optimize your metabolism so you can feel, look and perform your best, every day… yet without the yo-yo struggle of traditional approaches. Rather than a one-sized-fits-all approach like Paleo, Vegan, Keto, etc. we empower you with a flexible framework called our Metabolic OSTM that’s 100% customized to you. It allows you to get results fast and to sustain those results as your body, mind and daily life changes as you age. Without this flexible framework, those rigid approaches ultimately backfire, leaving you worse off.

What Key Skills and Experience are Needed?

  • 5+ years Front-End Development – You’ve got complete mastery of all front-end development languages (html/css/javascript) and popular frameworks for web, mobile, and single page apps
  • 3+ Years App + e-Commerce – You’ve been exposed to heavy development work building and optimizing mobile apps and responsive e-commerce websites
  • 2+ Years Optimization Experience – You’re well versed in how to sprint inside an environment of constant A/B split testing, building hypotheses, conducting tests and evaluating results
  • Pixel-perfect Mindset – You’ve got a very detail-oriented eye and know how to translate Zeplin mockups into pixel perfection and are bothered by anything that seems “off”
  • Obsessively Clean Coder – You take pride in writing clean, readable code that’s reusable and follows best practices and you feel compelled to correct any code that’s not up to par
  • Growth-Oriented – You love to constantly hone your skills via on-the-job learning opportunities, online learning courses and other challenges that keep your skills ahead of the curve
  • Driven to Excellence – You’ve got an ownership mentality with an innate inner drive to excellence that other people who aren’t built that way find disturbingly intense : -)
  • Relentlessly Persists – You stay focused until the task is done by embracing a get-it-done attitude and relentlessly attacking problems at different angles until they’re solved
  • Humble – You package all of the above skills inside a humble mindset in which you listen more than talk, absorb more than dictate and are in constant “beta” mode, learning all you can

What You'll Enjoy from Us:

  • A Curated Team – A very supportive team of other high-performers who like to get things done, hold themselves accountable and help each other out wherever possible
  • A Nurturing Culture – A culture that supports and nurtures your need to learn, grow and challenge yourself to be the best you possibly can be
  • A Fantastic Lifestyle – A 100% remote experience that allows you to work from home, enjoy your family, outside interests and passions
  • A Robust Benefits Package – Full Insurance (health/dental/vison/life/disability) + Robust 401k + 15 days PTO and additional perks as we add them

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $110,000.00 - $135,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • 401(k) matching
  • Dental insurance
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee discount
  • Flexible spending account
  • Health insurance
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Parental leave
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

job.body:

Full Job Description

Senior Node.js Developer

About NoFraud
NoFraud is an all-in-one fraud prevention solution that leverages a combination of human intelligence and AI-powered, multi-layered fraud screening technology to instantly detect and block fraudulent orders in real-time, eliminating chargebacks and boosting order approval rates.
Our proprietary process takes care of fraud from start to finish, no merchant involvement required.

With competitive rates, the industry's highest order approval rates, and guaranteed chargeback protection, NoFraud is the leading fraud prevention tool for eCommerce merchants who want to boost their bottom line and win the fight against fraud—for good. If that inspires you, keep reading.

Our team embodies the entrepreneurial spirit. We are driven by our common purpose and the desire to innovate, collaborate and excel.

On our team, you will get to dedicate most of your working time doing what you do best: building impressive software with other top-notch people in a fast-paced environment, and having fun doing it!.

Your accomplishments will be measured in user experience, quality improvements and innovations.

The gig
As a Node.js developer, you will work on APIs, eCommerce integrations and the back-end services of our Real-time Fraud Screening platform.

You will assist in the architecture, design, development and testing of these mission critical components of our flagship product to meet the needs of our customers and the rapid growth of our platform.

Who you are
You are an exceptionally talented software developer with the ability and desire to work on challenging projects that require you to constantly master new skills and technologies.

You are a self-starter with a growth mindset to join our start-up where innovation is valued.

You are a developer that understands business needs, scopes requirements, and builds scalable, high-impact solutions for our customers.

This role is ideal for well-rounded, ambitious developers who are always looking for new challenges.

Skills and Experience:

  • 5+ years experience working with Node.js
  • Excellent skills with JavaScript (ES6+)
  • Hands on experience with writing unit tests, and integration tests
  • Strong working experience with MySQL, RDS or other relational databases
  • Experience working with NoSQL databases (DynamoDB, MongoDB, etc.)
  • Experience with AWS or other Cloud Computer Platforms
  • Excellent understanding and experience developing Restful APIs
  • Experience building highly scalable SaaS applications handling large volumes of data
  • Experience developing with GIT or other version control systems
  • Working knowledge of Agile (Scrum) Software Development Process methodologies
  • Broad understanding of the design and architecture of modern web applications

Personal Attributes:

  • Flexible and adaptable in regards to learning and understanding new technologies;

  • Emphasize on quality, process, and iterative improvements.
  • A high bar for code quality and craftsmanship

Education:

Why you should work with us
This is a unique opportunity to work with an early stage, well-funded, start-up on the path to help eCommerce businesses prevent consumer fraud.

We work hard, and we have fun.

Success is what motivates us everyday to be the best and keep winning in the market.

We foster a diverse and inclusive workplace by hiring the best people from all walks of life. Our team members’ individual perspectives make us stronger, smarter and more innovative.

We offer a variety of perks to ensure our team can always work hard and play hard:

  • The freedom to be creative and the opportunity to grow professionally.
  • Generous paid time off policy.

Job Description:

AQUENT’s Financial Industry Client’s Digital Solutions team is looking to add a Senior Product Designer to its team. In this role, you will design financial digital products that help customers plan their financial futures.


Opportunity: This is a temp to perm position, open to remote candidates (as well as local Houston candidates).


What You’ll Do:

1 - In this role you will design financial digital products from native mobile apps to websites - full-life cycle. Familiarity with front-end development tools / capabilities and working with Design Systems in Invision DSM is a big plus.

2 - You will collaborate closely with product owners, business stakeholders, and front-end developers to build and launch polished/exceptional customer -facing digital experiences.

3 - You will work on the end-to-end product cycle (from research to interaction to visual design) and bring a keen eye for detail and ability to rapidly solve problems using a design thinking mindset.


The ideal Candidate:

  • You thrive on complex problems while balancing the phases of a user experience such as strategy, research, information architecture, interaction design and visual design.

We value your time in applying for this role. We are looking forward to reviewing your application.

job.title: Senior Frontend / Full Stack Software Engineer
job.body:
Our mission is to build software that creates understanding between people. Textio’s category-defining augmented writing platform has already transformed the way that thousands of companies write and hire, and we’re looking for a creative and driven frontend or full stack engineer to help us expand our product line.

As an engineer on the Application Engineering team you’ll work alongside industry-leading designers and product managers to help create ground-breaking user experiences. We are the team that builds the frontend for Textio’s user-facing applications, from everything you and our customers see on textio.com, to our Chrome browser extension and integrations, to new products currently under development. We thrive on technical challenges and building user interactions the world hasn’t seen before.

There is incredible opportunity to be part of the entire lifecycle of building new products: from early conception of very rough ideas, to using customer feedback to iterate and improve what you’ve built.

In this role you will:

  • Build human-centric UX with us using technologies like React, TypeScript, GraphQL, and CSS-in-JS. We value an ability to learn and grow together above knowing any particular technology
  • Focus on developing user experiences, with the option to jump in and solve hard problems across the entire stack
  • Drive technical investments from the early exploration of ideas to delivering integral parts of our stack, balancing short-term goals with long-term architectural vision
  • Mentor others on the team to help them grow as engineers across many dimensions
  • Lead technical initiatives or feature teams by partnering with teammates across Design, Product, Data Science, and Backend Engineering to drive complex features from start to finish

We’d love to hear from you if:

  • You take pride in creating powerful experiences that are simple and intuitive for users
  • You’re naturally curious about the technologies you use and take initiative to dive in, ask questions, and figure things out
  • You build those around you through mentoring, sharing what you know, and balancing the perspectives of everyone
  • You thrive in an environment that tests ideas by building
  • You have a track record of trying and learning new things
  • You have a point of view but are low ego

Right now, our employees are working from home. When we eventually reopen our Seattle office, we will continue to support remote work from Washington, New York, and California. Through 2021, we also support working remotely from Illinois, Colorado, Hawaii, and Oregon, but we may require physical relocation for employees in those states after 2021.

Textio embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. Textio will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you require accommodation please contact Josh Potter at recruiting@textio.com or (206) 492-8337 ext. 785.

Working at Textio is outstanding. Learn more about our philosophy, benefits, and team at https://textio.com/careers/. Reach out and share your story with us!

About Capgemini


Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services. The Group is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year+ heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company of 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of €17billion.

Visit us at www.capgemini.com. People matter, results count.

What We Offer


Your career matters to you and is important to us too. Because your goals and needs are constantly evolving, we offer visibility, leeway and support to help you grow and progress in your career. This approach builds notably on our comprehensive competency framework, our personal development, training and career management programs, and our University innovative and business-focused learning curriculums.


We promote a culture of diversity. We believe working with talented individuals from different backgrounds and points of view is a strategic advantage and an ongoing opportunity. Diversity enriches our creative solutions and adds value for our clients.


With the digital tech sector growing at a rapid pace and women significantly underrepresented in the industry, we are determined to inspire and recruit more women into technology and build diverse teams that reflect the clients we serve.


Our Shared values have been at the heart of the group since our formation. They are honesty, boldness, trust, freedom, team spirit, modesty and fun. These values influence the way we meet client needs while respecting the regulatory requirements of each country in which we operate, and the way we promote ethically sound practices within Capgemini and in our partnerships.


Capgemini is committed to building a workforce of employees with diverse backgrounds and work experiences. We strongly encourage women, veterans and active military service personnel to apply.

Senior-Level Visual Designer

We are looking for a talented senior-level Visual Designer to create amazing user experiences. The ideal candidate should have an eye for design, possess superior UI skills and be able to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and artifacts, and transform them into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces. In this role, you will work alongside a team of other designers to produce high-quality work. You should be able to work with minimal supervision.

If you’re passionate about design and eager to learn more, we’d like to hear from you!

Responsibilities

· Collaborate with product owners, UI developers, and business stakeholders to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals, and experience

· Provide guidance on design-centric implementations (visual hierarchy, interactive elements, iconography, typography, etc.)

· Ensure stylistic consistency within workflows, business capabilities, and applications

· Ensure visual accessibility concerns are addressed

· Ensure layout, content reflow, and general responsiveness concerns are addressed.

· Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off

· Conceptualize ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks

· Create hi-fidelity prototypes and process flows to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas

· Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders

· Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback

· Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards

Requirements

job.title: Frontend / Full Stack Software Engineer
job.body:
Our mission is to build software that creates understanding between people. Textio’s category-defining augmented writing platform has already transformed the way that thousands of companies write and hire, and we’re looking for a creative and driven frontend or full stack engineer to help us expand our product line.

As an engineer on the Application Engineering team you’ll work alongside industry-leading designers and product managers to help create ground-breaking user experiences. We are the team that builds the frontend for Textio’s user-facing applications, from everything you and our customers see on textio.com, to our Chrome browser extension and integrations, to new products currently under development. We thrive on technical challenges and building user interactions the world hasn’t seen before.

There is incredible opportunity to be part of the entire lifecycle of building new products: from early conception of very rough ideas, to using customer feedback to iterate and improve what you’ve built.

In this role you will:

  • Build human-centric UX with us using technologies like React, TypeScript, GraphQL, and CSS-in-JS. We value an ability to learn and grow together above knowing any particular technology
  • Focus on developing user experiences, with the option to jump in and solve hard problems across the entire stack
  • Share what you’ve learned about crafting outstanding user experiences with your teammates, so we can all grow faster
  • Participate in technical architecture discussions from the early exploration of ideas to deciding on a concrete path forward
  • Work in small, empowered feature teams with teammates across Design, Product, Data Science, and Backend Engineering to drive complex features from start to finish

We’d love to hear from you if:

  • You take pride in creating powerful experiences that are simple and intuitive for users
  • You’re naturally curious about the technologies you use and take initiative to dive in, ask questions, and figure things out
  • You thrive in an environment that tests ideas by building
  • You have a track record of trying and learning new things
  • You have a point of view but are low ego

Right now, our employees are working from home. When we eventually reopen our Seattle office, we will continue to support remote work from Washington, New York, and California. Through 2021, we also support working remotely from Illinois, Colorado, Hawaii, and Oregon, but we may require physical relocation for employees in those states after 2021.

Textio embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. Textio will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you require accommodation please contact Josh Potter at recruiting@textio.com or (206) 492-8337 ext. 785.


Working at Textio is outstanding. Learn more about our philosophy, benefits, and team at https://textio.com/careers/. Reach out and share your story with us!
